data.name: 0001 (387.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: For now, I'm gonna go cheer myself up by complaining to the Computer Society!

data.name: 0002 (387.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I won't be satisfied until I've given them a piece of my mind!

data.name: 0003 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: So said a wide-eyed Haruhi as she leapt off towards the clubroom building.

data.name: 0004 (387.ja) KYON_SIS (妹)
data.value: Hey, waaait, I'm coming toooo!

data.name: 0005 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Good grief…

data.name: 0006 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Miraculously, Haruhi has left. Looks like I can relax for the time being.

data.name: 0007 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Umm… It looks like everyone had a rough time.

data.name: 0008 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Indeed, it was quite the struggle.

data.name: 0009 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Koizumi, what effort did you even put in that you would call that a "struggle"?

data.name: 0010 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: At least I didn't see you do anything particularly helpful.

data.name: 0011 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: I was able to use my abilities in that space, although to a limited capacity.

data.name: 0012 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: I was blocking off anything from the abnormal space that might interfere with you.

data.name: 0013 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: You were…? I totally didn't notice.

data.name: 0014 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I wonder, could there have been blades of light flying towards me…

data.name: 0015 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: …like that time before, when I was attacked by a classmate?

data.name: 0016 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I'll just give you my thanks for now.

data.name: 0017 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: If we're offering thanks, then to the others as well. Everyone put in a distinguished effort.

data.name: 0018 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: He's absolutely right. If it weren't for everyone here, who knows what we'd have done.

data.name: 0019 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Asahina and Nagato, thank you for doing such a fine job.

data.name: 0020 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: No, not at all. Compared to everyone else…

data.name: 0021 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: All I did was talk with Suzumiya.

data.name: 0022 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: No, that's exactly what I mean—I can't imagine how hard it must've been.

data.name: 0023 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: But I suppose that's just another side of Asahina's charm

data.name: 0024 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Well then, shall we go pay a visit to the Computer Society as well?

data.name: 0025 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I guess so.

data.name: 0026 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Oh, right. The tea should be getting cold by now, right? I can brew some more.

data.name: 0027 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Asahina said so with a smile on her face. There's nothing like tea after hard work, right?

data.name: 0029 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Wait.

data.name: 0030 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: …What's wrong, Nagato?

data.name: 0031 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: We have not yet dealt with the source.

data.name: 0032 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Nagato was holding the laptop we got from inside the classroom.

data.name: 0033 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: So that thing is the main body of a data lifeform after all?

data.name: 0034 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: No.

data.name: 0035 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Huh…

data.name: 0036 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: In this device is one part of a data lifeform with limited functionality.

data.name: 0037 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Th-then the main body is still out there somewhere?!

data.name: 0039 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Nagato gave a simple nod.

data.name: 0040 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: We thought we'd defeated the final boss, but it turns out it was only a miniboss—

data.name: 0041 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: It seems we've been faced with an RPG trope so overplayed it's tiresome.

data.name: 0042 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: It appears to be in our best interest to deal with it quickly. Let's start immediately.

data.name: 0043 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: I'll go keep Suzumiya company.

data.name: 0044 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: There is no need. The main body is here.

data.name: 0045 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Nagato held out her other hand, within which was a thin slab the size of a postage stamp.

data.name: 0046 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Is that a memory card?

data.name: 0047 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Yes. A possession of the Computer Research Society president.

data.name: 0048 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: As she spoke, Nagato pointed directly at me.

data.name: 0049 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Wha…

data.name: 0050 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Kyon is…?

data.name: 0051 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Wait wait wait! It's me?!

data.name: 0052 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: No. The main body is there.

data.name: 0053 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: There…? Oh.

data.name: 0054 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Upon further inspection, Nagato was pointing at my chest pocket.

data.name: 0055 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: If I remember correctly, there should be a…

data.name: 0056 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: This is… the president's memory card?

data.name: 0058 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Pinching the memory card between my fingers, I held it up to my eyes.

data.name: 0059 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: It goes without saying, but it looked very much like a normal memory card.

data.name: 0060 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: The main body of the data lifeform sleeps within.

data.name: 0061 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: What do you mean, "sleeps"?

data.name: 0062 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Its functions are partitioned, and it has self compressed and suspended.

data.name: 0063 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Compressed and suspended… In other words, it wasn't active as a lifeform.

data.name: 0064 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: So that's why even Nagato couldn't find it at first.

data.name: 0065 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Yes.

data.name: 0067 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: So then, what are the functions you said it partitioned?

data.name: 0068 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: The ability to create potential space.

data.name: 0069 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: So it can do that, huh…

data.name: 0070 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I guess that's what the mysterious space was?

data.name: 0071 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: All it did was generate that nuisance of a room, so what was it trying to accomplish?

data.name: 0072 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: The data lifeform needed more information for its evolution process.

data.name: 0073 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: In order to support that, it transferred to a device with a greater storage capacity.

data.name: 0074 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: But a laptop has more storage than a memory card, right?

data.name: 0075 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: By invading a device that can more easily transmit, it has more chances to propagate.

data.name: 0076 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I suppose reaching a desktop computer would certainly be more comfortable than a laptop.

data.name: 0077 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: It's just like a virus, don't you think?

data.name: 0078 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: If it gained the ability to connect to the internet and perpetuate its evolution…

data.name: 0079 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: …It probably could have been able to spread throughout the entire world.

data.name: 0081 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: W-What!? Th-that would've been a disaster!

data.name: 0082 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: For sure. If we had left it alone, it would've eventually made its way to Haruhi.

data.name: 0084 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: If that happened, the world would've truly found itself in a crisis.

data.name: 0085 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Wh-what should we do now?

data.name: 0086 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: For the time being, we should do something about this memory card, right?

data.name: 0087 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Yes.

data.name: 0089 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: In order to delete its contents digitally, we'd need to temporarily connect it to a computer.

data.name: 0090 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: But, if it's a virus, won't it infect the—

data.name: 0091 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Physical deletion will suffice.

data.name: 0092 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: So you're saying we can just bend it with pliers or burn it in an incinerator?

data.name: 0094 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: If we don't wish for Miss Suzumiya to notice, we'll need to wait for another opportunity.

data.name: 0095 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: You really want me to just carry around something this dangerous?

data.name: 0096 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: We need to destroy it ASAP, don't you think? Put an end to Haruhi's curiosity.

data.name: 0097 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Otherwise, she'll say she wants to know the contents and bring it to the Computer Society.

data.name: 0098 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Here.

data.name: 0099 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: R-right.

data.name: 0100 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I place the memory card in Nagato's palm.

data.name: 0101 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: And just like that, it crumbles away into dust.

data.name: 0102 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: It had been completely destroyed within the palm Nagato's hand.

data.name: 0103 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: That's the Computer Society president's, right?

data.name: 0104 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Yes, but there wasn't another way.

data.name: 0105 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Do I need to give the president my condolences now?

data.name: 0106 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Well, that's all cleared up at last.

data.name: 0107 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: There won't be any more strange girls appearing…

data.name: 0108 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: …or any more getting locked in classrooms, right?

data.name: 0110 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Excuse me.

data.name: 0111 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: …Was there anything else?

data.name: 0112 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: What's this mop?

data.name: 0113 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: If you used it, you should tidy it up, you know?

data.name: 0115 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Ah, it's probably best you didn't touch that.

data.name: 0116 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Huh? Is there something special about it?

data.name: 0117 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Indeed there is. It's a mop especially made by Nagato that was used in the abnormal space.

data.name: 0119 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: It has an effect on the wave function, lowering probability of existance.

data.name: 0120 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Wha—?!

data.name: 0121 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Th-that's dangerous! That's dangerous, isn't it?!

data.name: 0122 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Absolutely. We should've disposed of it straight away.

data.name: 0123 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I used such a dangerous thing?

data.name: 0124 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I don't really get the theory anyway.

data.name: 0125 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: I see. Well, a more understandable example would be Schrödinger's cat.

data.name: 0126 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: What on earth is that?

data.name: 0127 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: In a box is a cat, radium, and a gas that releases in response to alpha particles.

data.name: 0128 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: The radium will occasionally omit said alpha particles.

data.name: 0129 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Then, after some time passes, you open the lid of the box.

data.name: 0130 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Well, is the cat in the box dead or alive?

data.name: 0131 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: If any of those particles have been emmitted it's dead, otherwise it's alive, right?

data.name: 0132 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Only the outcome is important here. Is it dead or alive?

data.name: 0133 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I don't know, it could be dead or alive, surely?

data.name: 0134 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Exactly right. That's what a wave function is.

data.name: 0135 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Until we observe, the outcome is unknown. It's a state where either case is possible.

data.name: 0136 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: We'll say it's fifty-fifty. But what if the chance leaned more in one direction?

data.name: 0137 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Let's say we increased the chance of a favorable outcome.

data.name: 0138 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Or perhaps, made an unfavorable outcome less likely.

data.name: 0139 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Is that even possible?

data.name: 0140 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: It seems to be. In this case, the chance of an abnormal space existing was increased.

data.name: 0141 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Nagato's modified mop removed that possibility again.

data.name: 0142 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: There's even a person close to us who does it unconsciously.

data.name: 0143 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Haruhi, huh?

data.name: 0144 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Exactly. As long as she wishes for the cat to live.

data.name: 0145 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: It wouldn't matter how long you leave it, the cat would still be alive, right?

data.name: 0146 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Far from it…

data.name: 0147 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Far from it?

data.name: 0148 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: It probably would've turned into something else other than a cat—maybe even grown wings.

data.name: 0149 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Her head's full of fantasies, huh. She should become a magician or something.

data.name: 0150 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Highly developed science is indistinguishable from magic.

data.name: 0151 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Miss. Asahina, is the technique for your time travel science or magic?

data.name: 0153 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Umm… it's probably [classified information], but it's nothing like magic.

data.name: 0154 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: …It's exactly as he says.

data.name: 0155 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: The what about you, Nagato? Science, or magic?

data.name: 0156 (387.ja) MIKURU (みくる)
data.value: Umm…

data.name: 0157 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Humans label hidden knowledge and things they don't understand…

data.name: 0158 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: …as occult.

data.name: 0159 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: When you say occult… you mean scary stories and myths?

data.name: 0160 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: People react to things they don't know with awe and fear. That's why.

data.name: 0161 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: It certainly seems so. Even the mop that just rolled in front of me is unknown to me.

data.name: 0162 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I don't know if it's the pinnacle of science or if it houses some magical energy.

data.name: 0163 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: So what is it, then?

data.name: 0164 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Anything the mop wipes has its probability of existing reduced.

data.name: 0165 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: It perhaps—no—it truly does stop things from existing.

data.name: 0166 (387.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Isn't that right, Miss. Nagato?

data.name: 0167 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Yes.

data.name: 0168 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: It's a magic mop that can remove anything?

data.name: 0169 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: This mop seems to be quite terrifying.

data.name: 0170 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Nothing like the homing bat, this is some next level insanity.

data.name: 0171 (387.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Nagato, please, could you hurry up and get rid of this terrifying thing?

data.name: 0172 (387.ja) NAGATO (長門)
data.value: Understood.

data.name: 0173 (387.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Good grief. Well, I guess everything's settled now then.

data.name: 0174 (387.ja) INFO (CHOICE)
data.value: About Haruhi
